Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property is located on Westow Hill, a popular local High Street.



Nearby retailers include Café Nero, Shelter and Iceland.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The shop premises are arranged over ground and basement floors and consist of the following approximate floor areas:

Tenure
The property is held on an FRI Lease due to expire  24th March 2023 at a passing rental of £33,500 per annum exclusive.

Consideration
Incentives available subject to covenant status for an assignment.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £33,750 and the rates payable are £16,571.25 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Within Close Proximity to Southfields Underground Station

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Southfields is a thriving centre located within The London Borough of Wandsworth and is home to The All England Lawn Tennis Club.

The premises are situated in a prominent location on the western side of Wimbledon Park Road, close to the junction with Augustus Road and Replingham Road and on the main route through to the Tennis Championships.

Other occupiers within the immediate vicinity include Franco Manca, Costa and Caffé Nero.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is situated over ground floor only.  Approximate areas are as follows:

Lease Terms
The premises are available on a new effective full repairing and insuring sub-lease from Sainsbury’s for a term of years to be agreed.

Rent
£50,000 per annum exclusive.

Legal Costs
Each party is to be responsible for their own professional costs incurred in relation to this transaction.

Rates
The reconfigured property is yet to be re-assessed so all interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property, located in the London Borough of Lewisham, 10 minutes’ walk from both Catford Bridge and Catford Railway Stations, connecting the area with London Bridge in under 15 minutes. The property is directly opposite Nando’s, with Aldi also nearby, providing an hour free parking for customers.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is situated over ground floor only, made up of the main betting hall, with a small kitchenette and toilets at the rear of the property

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment or sublease of the existing lease expiring 28/09/2027.

Rent
£28,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We understand that the current Rateable Value is £21,000 and the Rates Payable are £10,311 per annum.  The UBR for 2019/20 is 49.1p. 

Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Clapham Junction is a densely populated residential area in South West London, located approximately 4 miles south west of central London.
The subject property fronts Falcon Road and backs onto Clapham Junction Station; one of London's busiest train stations which is likely to benefit from major redevelopment in the coming years. Nearby occupiers include Debenhams, Metro Bank, Revolution, Wholefoods and Lidl.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property comprises a ground floor retail unit offering a wide frontage to Falcon Ro ad

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 01/01/2022.
Alternatively, the premises are available on a sublease.

Rent
£90,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We understand that the current Rateable Value is £62,000 and the Rates Payable are £31,620 per annum. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 50.4p.
Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Blackheath, located on the border of the Royal Borough of
Greenwich and the London Borough of Lewisham, is an
affluent area in southeast London. Situated approximately
8 miles from Central London, the town is well served by
public transport, with trains running from Blackheath Train
Station to London Bridge in less than 15 minutes.
The village has a mix of national and independent retailers,
with Waterstones, Jigsaw, Whistles and Oliver Bonas all
being nearby to the subject property

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property consists of ground floor only, which was
formerly used as the main banking hall, with ancillary
space and staff rooms at the back. The unit benefits from 3
car parking spaces at the rear of the property.

Tenure
The property is held on an existing FRI lease due to expire
25/11/2023 at a passing rent of £78,000 per annum
exclusive.

Rent
Offers considered on the basis of an assignment or
sublease at the current passing rent.

Rates
We are informed by the Local Rating Authority that the
current rateable value of the property is £32,000 and the
rates payable are £15,712. The UBR for 2019/20 is
49.1p.
Interested parties should make their own enquiries in this
regard.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The restaurant is located in Chelsea Barracks, a world class master plan comprising apartments, townhouses, garden squares and amenities and  spread over 12.8 acres.  The development is located close to Sloane Square Tube Station.  

Nearby occupiers include  Daylesford, Gordon Ramsey, Linley of Belgravia and Tiffany.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The restaurant is located across the ground and lower ground floors providing a total of 8,315 sq ft with extensive terracing providing the opportunity for all day dining on Garrison Square.

Rent
On application.

Rates
To be assessed.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are located on Kings Road close to the junction with Sloane
Square, Chelsea, opposite The Duke of York Square. This area benefits
from a large, affluent residential catchment and consists of high-quality
fashion and beauty retailers.
The subject property occupies a prominent position near Lululemon and
Peter Jones Department Store. Other new entrants in the vicinity include
Castore, Slowear and De Fursac.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The unit offers an open plan sales area with staff amenities to the rear.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of assignment or sublease of the
existing lease expiring 20/12/2027.
This rare lease is contracted within the security of tenure provisions of the
Landlord and Tenant Act 1954.
Substantial incentives available, subject to covenant & timing.

Rent
£232,000 per annum.

Rates
The Rateable Value for 20/21 is £222,000 and the Rates Payable are
£120,324. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with
the Local Authority for verification purposes.
Business rates are not payable for the 20/21 financial year. Business rates
relief may be extended beyond this date. Please make your own enquiries.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Chiswick is an affluent suburb with a village feel in West London, located approximately 6 miles from central London.
The subject property is located within the heart of Chiswick on the north side of Chiswick High Road and opposite the junction with Heathfield Terrace.
Nearby occupiers include Santander, Boots, Waitrose, WH Smith and Robert Dyas.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property comprises a ground floor retail unit and first floor ancillary space.

Tenure
New FRI lease available.

Rent
£80,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We understand that the current Rateable Value is £85,000 and the Rates Payable are £43,690 per annum. The UBR for 2020/2021 is 51.4p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: High quality retail space situated on Brompton Road in the heart of Knightsbridge. Conveniently located between Knightsbridge and South Kensington stations providing great connectivity as well as being on the corner of Brompton Place which provides access to Harrods car park.. Nearby retailers include Harrods, Zara, and Church Shoes.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over the ground floor, first floor and
basement.

Tenure
The property is available by way of a new lease for a term to be agreed, subject to 5 yearly upward only rent reviews.

Rent
Available on request.

Rates
Rateable Value for 2021/22: £335,000.  There are  currently no rates payable until 30th June 2021. Beyond this, 66% relief is granted, for eligible occupiers from 1st July 2021 -31st March  022.  All relief is per business not per property. Parties are advised to make their own enquiries  with the local authority as to the relevant level of relief

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Rare opportunity to acquire a store of circa 1,700 sq ft in the heart of Kensington in an affluent local shopping population.  Located close to numerous tourist attractions, including The Design Museum, which is located 300 metres to the west, attracting circa 780,000 people in its first year.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over the ground floor only providing the following approximate dimensions and net internal floor areas:

Tenure
The subject property is available on a new effective Full Repairing & Insuring Lease for a term of 10 years or more outside the Landlord & Tenant Act 1954 Part II and subject to 5 yearly rent reviews.

Rent
On application.

Rates
The Rateable Value will need to be re-assessed following
landlords subdivision works.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The subject property is situated in a prime location on Shepherd Market in the affluent area of Mayfair. The area is predominantly occupied by a variety or independent restaurants and bars, such as Shepherd Market Wine House, L’Eto Mayfair, Le Boudin Blanc, and Yazi sushi.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground and lower ground floor and comprise the following approximate net internal areas.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 25 December 2026. There is a Tenant break clause at 25 December 2021 to provide additional flexibility.

Rent
£78,000 per annum exclusive

Terms
Offers are invited for the leasehold interest. Alternatively, the landlord may be prepared to grant a new lease, subject to vacant possession.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £55,500 and the rates payable are £27,972 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 50.4p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is situated in a prime position on Acton High Street, north west London. The recently redeveloped Oaks Shopping Centre, home to Lidl, Wilko, Superdrug, Iceland, Boots, The Gym and others is situated 50m from the property.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged to provide ground and basement retail accommodation with office/ancillary at first floor (with separate access if required). The second and third floor provide self-contained residential flats which are both tenanted.

Tenure
The premises is held on an Effective FRI
lease expiring 25/07/2023 at a passing rent of £77,000 per annum with no
further reviews.



The
lease is held subject to 2x residential AST’s generating a income of £33,660
pa. Further detail available upon request

Terms
The property is available by way of assignment or sublease on terms to be agreed.

Alternatively, a new lease may be available from the Landlord.

Rates
We are informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the property is £38,000. 

Interested parties should make their own enquiries in this regard.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Jermyn Street is a major thoroughfare through St James’ and is internationally renown for high-end menswear and accessories. The property is located at the eastern end of the street, between the junctions with Duke of York Street and Babmaes Street, benefitting from proximity to Green Park and Piccadilly Circus underground stations. Nearby occupiers include Hawes and Curtis, Waterstones and Charles Tyrwhitt.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:

Tenure
The property is available by way of a new effective FRI lease for a term to be agreed.

Rent
On Application

Rates
We have been advised by the Local Authority that the premises are currently exempt from paying business rates until 30 June 2021. Prospective tenants are advised to confirm any rating liability or eligibility for further relief directly with the Local Authority. For guidance purposes, the current Rateable Value for the property is £370,000 with rates payable 2020/2021 £193,880.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The premises are located on the northern side of Dover Street in very close proximity to the junction with Stafford Street. The subject premises are located in a prime location on Dover Street within the affluent area of Mayfair. Adjacencies include Sicis and Casa di Stefano restaurant. Other occupiers in the vicinity include, The Arts Club, Acne, Arthur Morrice and Victoria Beckham.

Tenure

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease until 10 June 2022.

Rent
£220,450 per annum exclusive

Rates

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Bedford Street is located in Central London in the Borough of Westminster between Covent Garden and Charing Cross.

The subject property is situated at the southern end of Bedford Street in close proximity to Charing Cross Station and Leicester Square providing excellent transport links across London. Adjacencies include Pret a Manger and The Adelphi Theatre. Other occupiers in the vicinity include Boots, Argos, Topshop, H&M and Café Nero.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over basement level with the benefit of a dedicated ground floor entrance and street signage. They comprise the following approximate net internal area.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 1 October 2026. There is a mutual break option on 2 October 2021.  The lease is held within the Landlord and Tenant Act 1954.

Rent
£72,000 per annum exclusive, subject to review in October 2021.

Terms
Incentives available, subject to status.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £62,000 and the rates payable are £31,248 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 50.4p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Covent Garden continues to deliver new lettings to cool concepts and the location is now the most “current” estate in Europe – with a great mix of food, leisure, retail, public realm and heritage.  

We are boosting sustainability credentials and promoting “zero emissions”, while also trying to green as much of the estate as possible – the Floral Street plans are a fantastic example of this. 

As a result Capco drive significant footfall through the estate, promoting occupiers and its safe leisure location passionately. 

Further, the estate is number 1 for social media interest.   

In 2019 we attracted 15 new brands: APC, American Vintage, Glossier, Ganni, Polo Ralph Lauren, Hawkers, Dominque Ansel, Vashi, Neuhaus and Big Mamma.  

KEY BRANDS

Aesop, American Vintage, APC, APM Monaco, Apple, Atelier Cologne, Bas&sh, Balthazar, Bucherer, Buns & Buns, Chanel, Charlotte Tilbury, Cora Pearl, Deciem, Din Tai Fung, Dior, Experimental Cocktail Club, For Arts Sake, Fred Perry, Free People, Frenchie, Galeria Melissa, Ganni, Glossier, Happy Socks, Henrietta Hotel, Hotel Chocolat, Jigsaw, Jo Malone, Joseph Cheaney, Kent & Curwen, K-Way, Laduree, Lima Floral, Lulu Guinness, Mariage Freres, Michael Kors, Miller Harris, Molton Brown, Mulberry, N Peal, NARS, Nigel Cabourn, Oliver Sweeney, Olivia Burton, One Peloton, Paul Smith, Petersham Nurseries, Polo Ralph Lauren, RedFarm, Sandro, Shake Shack, Sticks n Sushi, Sushisamba, The Alkemistry, The Ivy Market Grill, The Oystermen, Tiffany & Co, Tom Davies, Tom Ford, VyTA.

Tenure
New Lease.

Rent
On application.

Rates
On application.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are situated in The Market Building located in the worldrenowned
Covent Garden, near The Piazza. This area benefits from a large
and affluent catchment, attracting a high volume of tourists both
domestically and internationally. The Market Building consists of highquality
fashion and beauty retailers.
The subject property occupies a prominent position near Penhaligon’s, and
is within proximity to Tom Ford, Dior Boutique and Deciem Health & Beauty.

Rates

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property is situated prominently on New Bond Street - Mayfair, cornering New Bond street and Grosvenor Street. 

This location will be directly opposite Versace's new flagship and close to Brunello Cucinelli's and Celine's new flagship stores.

Nearby retailers include Loewe, Smythson, Roger Vivier, Azzedine Alaia, Wempe Zegna, Fendi and Chloe.

Rates

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Luxury retail opportunity in the heart of Bond Street

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Covent Garden is London’s most vibrant shopping neighbourhood attracting over 40 million customers a year, whose demographics have changed dramatically in recent years following the influx of high-end brands such as Apple, Bucherer, Burberry, Tom Ford, Charlotte Tilbury, Chanel, Dior, Mulberry and The Shop at Bluebird. These retailers sit alongside other key brands to ensure customers can shop and dine at every level including Sandro, Jo Malone, Fred Perry, Links of London, Daniel Wellington and Nars. Key restaurants such as Petersham Nurseries, Ladurée and Balthazar will soon be joined by Sushi Samba, Red Farm, Vyta and Din Tai Fung. Covent Garden also benefits from 19 million square feet of offices within a half mile radius, 300,000 people per day coming through the closest stations of Covent Garden, Leicester Square, Charing Cross and Holborn whilst there are 2,500 hotel rooms within a quarter mile with an average room rate of over £500.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Tenure
The unit is available for a term to be agreed and is to

Upon application.

Rates

The property occupies a prominent location on the west side of Langley Court, which connects Long Acre and Floral Street in the heart of Covent Garden. The retail unit is situated at the bottom end of Langley Court right next to Capco’s Kings Court & Floral Street development which will provide circa 45,000 sq. ft. of retail space and restaurant space on Floral Street and Kings Court. 



Nearby operators include; Paul Smith,  Ted Baker, Bloom Beauty Saloon, Kate Spade, Diptyque and Radley.

The property is located in the middle of Queensway, opposite Bayswater Underground Station providing connections across London on the District and Circle Lines.  The property is a short walk from Queensway Underground Station providing connections across London via the Circle Line.  Together the two stations have approximate entry and exit figures of 13.2 million pa.

Nearby occupiers include Burger King, McDonald's, Tesco Express, Barclays Bank and Carphone Warehouse.

New Lease

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The premises are located close to Cheapside to the west, and Bank Station, adjacent to Soho House group’s Ned Hotel and opposite 1 Poultry, which is set to become WeWork co-working offices.Retailers in the vicinity include Boots Opticians, Ernest Jones, Massimo Duttiand Nespressoas well as Bloomberg’s new HQ.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property occupies a prominent position fronting The Broadway, in the West London borough of Ealing. The unit is external facing from British Land’s Ealing Broadway Shopping Centre and benefits from the immediate adjacency of M&S as well as Holland & Barrett, Monsoon and Itsu which form the primary entrance to the scheme. Immediately opposite, TK Maxx and Morrisons Supermarket anchor the north side of The Broadway.

The property is situated just a three-minute walk from Ealing Broadway rail & underground station providing easy access to Central London via the Central and District Lines, along with the mainline railway. Ealing Broadway is to become a key Crossrail station with over 200m due to use the line from Autumn 2019; the town already has in excess of 20m rail and tube passengers per annum.

Berkley St George have recently completed a new 100,000 sq. ft. retail leisure development with its primary entrance diagonally opposite the subject property.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property provides retail sales accommodation over ground, first and second floors. Ancillary and staff accommodation is provided at third floor. Servicing is via the basement with a goods and passenger lift to all levels.

Terms

Rates

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Aldgate, located in Greater London, is within the Borough of tower Hamlets.

The subject property is situated opposite Aldgate Underground Station and close to the junction of Commercial Street and Whitechapel High Street, providing excellent links to Spitalfields and Central London.  The adjacent retailers include Costa, Boots, Pret A Manger, Itsu and Black Sheep Coffee.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:

Ideal for retail, gym and entertainment uses
Excellent ceiling heights in excess of 4 metres
Potential to create up to 50,000 sq ft unit

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Argyll Street boasts a vibrant mix of retail, F&B and entertainment uses with numerous flagship stores in the vicinity including Gentle Monster, Vans, Microsoft, Nike, Asics and TK Maxx.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The unit benefits from consistently high levels of footfall from early until late. Argyll Street is anchored by Oxford Street to the north and the world renowned Liberty Department Store to the south, making it an extremely sought after location.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Oxford Street is the global flagship store destination.  This is a unique opportunity to acquire a building on Oxford Street East, on the edge of Soho, blending retail and office space for a brand to make its mark.

The subject premises are situated in a prime position adjacent to global and national brands including H&M, Uniqlo, Flannels, Marks & Spencer, Next and EE.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject premises are located on London’s busiest
shopping street, in close proximity to the new
Tottenham Court Road Crossrail terminal.
The unit is adjacent to Lloyds Bank and Polette. Other

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The subject property occupies a prominent corner position
at the junction of the south side of Old Broad Street and
London Wall in the City. The unit is within walking distance
to various Underground and Overground train stations,
including Liverpool Street, Bank and Moorgate. It will
benefit from the arrival of Crossrail in Q1 2022.
Local occupiers include Hackett London, Timpson and
Rituals.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property itself is arranged over ground floor and
basement only. The ground floor provided the main
banking hall, along with interview and staff rooms. The
ground floor has glazed frontages to both Old Broad Street
and London Wall. The basement formed a large ancillary
space used for staff and storage purposes.
There are 3 car spaces demised in the basement car park.

Tenure
The property is held on an existing FRI lease due to expire
23/06/2023 at a passing rent of £434,000 per annum
exclusive.

Consideration
Offers considered on the basis of an assignment or
sublease at the current passing rent.

EPC
Energy Efficiency rating is D-97
Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Rates
We are informed by the Local Rating Authority that the
current rateable value of the property is £402,500 and the
rates payable are £214,130.
Interested parties should make their own enquiries in this
regard.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
This bustling thoroughfare in Fitzrovia’s most spectacular new development, offers the opportunity to take space alongside some of London’s most exciting independent brands and international concepts.
Recent openings include sustainable coffee and lifestyle brand Whitepine, Tokyo based Omotesando Koffee and Digme Fitness, who will soon be joined by Cafe Terra, Lab Store, and the cult Parisian restaurant group Big Mamma.
The Rathbone Square development also encompasses 142 high and luxury apartments and 243,000 Sq.ft offices entirely let to Facebook. The closest tube station is Tottenham Court Road where an approx. 41 million people enter and exit every day and the Dean Street Cross Rail entrance will open only 75m away from Rathbone Square.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over the ground floor

Rent
On application

Terms
The unit is available to let by way of a
new lease for a term to be agreed.
The lease will be contracted outside the security of tenure and compensation provisions of the Landlord & Tenant
Act 1954 Part II.

Rates
Rates are to be assessed

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is situated towards the southern end of Brick Lane, close to junctions with Fashion Street and Whitechapel Street. The unit benefits from high footfall as well as its close proximity to Aldgate East Station. Nearby operators predominantly include an eclectic mix of independent restauranteurs and fashion retailers, such as The Buxton, Salad Box, Bengal Cuisine, Epra Fabrics, and Zaman Brothers interspersed with the likes of The Culpepper pub, Absurd Bird, and Sticky Wings.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground floor and lower ground and comprise the following approximate net internal area.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 28 September 2021.  The lease benefits from 1954 Act security of tenure provisions.

Rent
£28,500 per annum exclusive for the retail space.

£46,000 per annum exclusive for the retail unit + 2 flats.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £41,750 and the rates payable are £20,499.25 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy a prominent position on the northern side of Edgware
Road in Central London. The unit is close to both Edgware Road and Marble
Arch underground stations, as well as being a short walk from London
Paddington Railway Station. The unit sits immediately adjacent to Caffe
Nero and McDonalds, with Waitrose, and Argos within the same block.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises ground and basement retail accommodation

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease
expiring 08/08/2032 with no breaks.
A sublease may also be available.

Rent
£155,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We understand that the current Rateable Value is £126,000 and the Rates
Payable are £66,024 per annum. The UBR for 2019/20 is 52.4p.
Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local
Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Spitalfields is a thriving, 7-day destination that attracts a diverse mix of workers, tourists, students, shoppers and locals alike. 112-114 Middlesex Street is situated on the walking route from Liverpool Street Station (London’s 3rd busiest station) to Spitalfields Market, 300 metres away. The renowned Petticoat Lane and Wentworth Street markets 
are on the doorstep and open six days a week; Middlesex Street Market is open every Sunday.

The immediate area is home to notable F&B operators including including Ottolenghi, Wahaca, Franco Manca, Honest Burger and a host of vibrant independents, major brands and local favourites.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The units will be handed over in warm shell condition, and will comprise of the following gross internal floor areas:

112 Middlesex Street

Ground Floor: 580 sq ft / 53.9 sqm

Basement: 180 sq ft / 16.7 sqm

Total: 760 sq ft / 70.6 sqm

(NB. There is the option to provide an additional 354 sq ft at GF, subject to VP. This could provide a total 942 sq ft at ground floor).

114 Middlesex Street

Ground Floor: 360 sq ft / 33.4 sqm

Basement: 444 sq ft / 42 sqm

Total: 804 sq ft / 75.4 sqm

Rent
112 Middlesex Street: £55,000 per annum exclusive

114 Middlesex Street: £30,000 per annum exclusive

Terms
The units are available on a new lease and can be leased together or individually.

Rates
Subject to confirmation.

Further details are available from www.voa.gov.uk

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
A unique opportunity to be part of a newly curated parade of retail units in the heart of Fitzrovia.   Great Portland Street provides an opportunity to create a new and vibrant mix of food and beverage and retail operators to complement the existing occupiers and service the wide and varied demographic in the area.  

A large number of best-in-class office developments have completed in Fitzrovia delivering a significant increase in office occupiers including Estée Lauder, WCRS and Facebook.  This coupled with the redevelopment of BBC’s Broadcasting House in 2012 and The Crown Estate’s progressive asset management strategy to introduce brands such as Psycle, DryBy, Workshop Coffee, Ted’s Grooming Room,  Glow Bar, Moleskine and Innovation by  Space NK now attracts a young, diverse and affluent audience to this part of Fitzrovia. 

Other nearby occupiers include Caravan, Mortimer House, The Whiskey Exchange, Clutch, The Riding House Cafe, Define London, The Portland and Knomo to name a few.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Rent
On application.

Terms
The subject premises will be available, on a  new lease on the standard Crown Estate terms for a duration of 10 years.

Rates
To be assessed.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises a ground floor retail unit which sits beneath a period style building arranged over nine floors with retail space at ground, lower ground and basement levels and office accommodation on the ground and upper floors.
The property is located in a prominent position overlooking Victoria Square and on the corner of Waterloo Street and New Street. Birmingham New Street and Snow Hill Train Stations are within easy walking distance.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor only.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease for a term of years to be agreed.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £31,500.00. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The subject property is located in a prominent position on Northways Parade, near the Royal School of Speech and Drama.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The shop premises are arranged over ground floor only

Tenure
The property is held on a leasehold basis due to expire 5th February 2024 at a passing rental of £48,500 per annum exclusive.

Consideration
Incentives available on assignment subject to covenant status.

Rates
We are informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current rateable value of the property is £48,000 and the rates payable are £23,527. The UBR for 2019/20 is 49.1. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property is situated opposite The Cottonworks, a new development creating 22 apartments on the busy Seven Sisters Road.

Located within a five minute walk to Finsbury Park Station, the area provides excellent connections to Central London on either the Victoria or Piccadilly lines. Other nearby stations include Arsenal and Holloway Road.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises a double frontage unit, situated over ground floor only. Internally the area is spacious with a small kitchenette and toilets, with rear access leading to a small courtyard.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment or sublease of the existing lease expiring 11/06/2023.

Rent
£28,500 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value is £26,250 and the Rates Payable are £12,888 per annum. The UBR for 2019/20 is 49.1p.
Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Stoke Newington, located in North London, is within Zone 2
of the London transport network. The property is located
along Stoke Newington High Street, on the corner of Stoke
Newington Church Street in the London Borough of
Hackney.
Also known as the A10, the High Street is a busy
thoroughfare leading to Stamford Hill and Seven Sisters to
the north, and Dalston and Shoreditch to the south. The
nearest station is Stoke Newington, which provides services
to London Liverpool Street.
The retail pitch is mixed and predominantly comprises
independent, local retailers. Some national retailers include
Sports Direct, Halfords, Iceland and Sainsbury's Local.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is made up of a ground floor and basement
retail unit, with separate access to two residential flats on the
upper two floors. The flats include one 1 bedroom flat and
one 2 bedroom flat

Tenure
Effectively full repairing and insuring
lease for a term to be agreed.

Rent
£50,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that
the current Rateable Value of the unit is £50,000 pa and
the rates payable are £24,550 pa.
The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p.
Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries
with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Tottenham is a predominately residential area located approximately 6 miles North East of London Central.

The subject property is situated among a diverse mix of local retailers including food, fashion and service operators, as well as some cafes and restaurants.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises a double fronted ground floor retail unit fronting West Green Road.  The unit offers an open plan sales area with amenities to the rear which include two toilets, kitchenette and storage areas.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 04/01/2023 with a further right of renewal.
A copy of the lease is available on request.

Rent
£23,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £23,500.00 and the rates payable are £11,538.50 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes
